TI: Neural Oscillations: Primates Have Sharp Memories Too.
AB: Sharp wave-ripples in the hippocampus are believed to play a key role in memory formation: they have been observed in many mammalian species, but until recently their contribution to memory had been studied only in rodents. A new study suggests a similar importance for memory in primates.
